title: Identifying Poisonous Saltwater Fish
brief: Recognize dangerous saltwater fish species that have poisonous flesh or transmit toxins.
steps: Step 1: AVOID porcupine fish, triggerfish, cowfish, thorn fish, oilfish, red snapper, jack, and puffer fish.
Step 2: Be cautious with barracuda - while not poisonous itself, it may transmit ciguatera if eaten raw.
Step 3: Cook saltwater fish caught within reefs or near freshwater sources as a precaution.
Step 4: Fish caught in open ocean farther from shore can be eaten raw due to saltwater environment.
Step 5: Learn to identify the distinctive shapes and features of poisonous species.
warnings: Some saltwater fish have permanent poison in their flesh, others only seasonally.
Cooking does not destroy the toxins in poisonous fish species.
Ciguatera poisoning from barracuda can cause severe illness even if fish is cooked.
When in doubt about fish identification, do not eat it.
